Reviews.Title: “the real art hotel!well done!”
Reviews.Author: pinnychan
Reviews.Content: don't miss this hotel if you plan to stay in berlin!this is a great and warm and funny place!well place(in mitt zone)just 5 min to the S-b and if you came from the tiegel apt you have the bus stop just in front of the hotel.you have everything around you can reach every attractions,pubs,restaurant just walking! the rooms are absolutely fantastic(we tried the cabin room and the station room)!our offer doesn't include the breakfast but you can have it for 11euros(fully great buffet)or to try one of the cafe just around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Original and central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Agnieszka M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, and had a very good experience, in two different rooms in order to enjoy two artworks. The first room on the street side was very funky, large, clean and nice. We could hear the trains, but it did not bother us and we both slept well. The second room was on the rail side, but as it was in the new building, we could hardly hear the trains, so again slept well. The art was less exciting, as it wasn't a spatial installation, which was a pity, but nevertheless it was an interesting work. Service perfect, and location extremely handy to explore Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Mitte”
Reviews.Author: Nancy D
Reviews.Content: Just finished a two night stay. I would highly recommend this hotel. Great English speaking staff, close to Hoppenhof and S/U Bahn. Super funky and original rooms, clean bathrooms down the hall, and enough cafes close by. My only negatives would be the train tracks are very close if you are in a room that faces the street, they do provide earplugs. I was there in March so you could not hear the trains with the windows closed, but may be an issue in the summer. But after 2 days full of walking I slept great. Please be aware there is no elevator if you have difficulty with stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix2Sydney
Reviews.Content: Single room with shared shower facilities for EU39 per night. The room is small but uniquely decorated - quite literally as every room has been designed by a well-known artist. The top floor (4) corridor accessible by elevator or a grand staircase. The showers down the hallway are spotless and totally functional. Reception is efficient and local restaurants go from inexpensive to very grand. The location could scarcely be bettered, with Freidrichstrasse station just 10 minutes walk away (connection in 30 mins to Schönefeld Airport), and the express bus to Tegel airport just across the street. The Reichstag is 5 minutes walk as is the Brandenburg Gate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: OluOlu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel in Mid October earlier this year when Berlin was in the middle of what the Brits call an Indian Summer. The temperatures were in the high twenties C and Berlin was glorious and full of colour. Arte Luise Kunsthotel was a splendid arty hotel located within walking distance of the Brandenburg Gates. Situated in a grand old building with a lovely huge old fashion staircase, each room had a different teem and was painted by various local Artists. I had a single room on the 3rd floor which was reasonably priced and comfortable and I didn't even mind the fact that the hotel didn't have a lift. The staff were ever so friendly and attentive but are the same time casual enough as not to be over bearing. Entering the reception gave you a good idea of what was in store in this hotel. This was a fun arty hotel that didn't take itself too seriously. I was certainly happy with my choice. The room itself was beautiful! Devoid of any unnecessary clutter like a mini bar or a 42 inch LCD flat screen TV because all I wanted is a bed, a clean bathroom and free Internet. I had read in some reviews that because of its proximity to a railway line it is noisy and difficult to sleep. Really? I had the window open all 3 nights I spent here and I slept like a baby. The place was tranquil and I am usually not a heavy sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Couple in their fifties”
Reviews.Author: christina c
Reviews.Content: We spend five nights in room nr.106. Although our room where facing the street, it was nice and quiet thanks to the double windows. The room was exiting bit still peacefull and airy with a hight of at least five meters to the roof. The feeling was "homey" and the nice staff cleaned our room what ever time we decided to leave,11AM or 2PM. Excellent location. To be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lock up your things!”
Reviews.Author: Erin W
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience at the Arte Luise Kunsthhotela little over a year ago! Despite the beautiful rooms and great location it did not make up for having my iPod and nice jacket stolen from my room. If you stay here PLEASE lock up your valuables, the staff cannot be trusted and you will not even get as much as an apology from management.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but no A/C and noisy train tracks”
Reviews.Author: JB854
Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience. The front desk staff are helpful, the Wi-Fi was problem-free, and the rooms themselves are of course fun and interesting. The location can't be beat: <10 minutes walk to the main train station, Reichstag, Unter den Linden, Brandenburg Gate, etc. Two things to be aware of. First, not all rooms have air conditioning. Our room (Endmoräne Berlin) had a small fan, but given July temperatures in the 80s F (mid-20s C), the room temperature was uncomfortable. Second, the rooms facing Luisenstrasse are extremely noisy. The hotel is right next to the tracks for S-Bahn and Regio trains, which come screeching around the corner as they approach Hauptbahnhof. The windows actually do a good job at blocking the noise but, again, given the heat we would have liked to keep our windows open.

Reviews.Title: “interesting hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: katec62
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in this most interesting hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location is excellent for getting about and seeing the sights and there are many restaurants within easy strolling distance. Very comfortable bed (ours suspended from ceiling!) and delightful courtyard view. Staff all very helpful too!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Auberiginas
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for all the sights. Easy to get to from the Airport. The Airport bus stops 50 yards from the hotel. Hotel itself is superb - boutique room, each with art designed by a contemporary artist. Quiet. Such good value for money and the voucher for breakafast next door was such good value with a pleasing range of fresh food and bakery.

Reviews.Title: “A Real special hotel”
Reviews.Author: hhmn
Reviews.Content: An interesting and different hotel. Stayed in a room with shared bathroom. Bath and restroom in hallway were clean and available. It is possible to find a cheaper hotel with comparable location, But if you want to stay in a place you'll remeber, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel, good location, budget friendly, good service.”
Reviews.Author: rkt75
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of their airplane themed rooms on the older side of the hotel so no elevator but the desk clerk was great and brought our bags up for us since they were a tad heavy. The stairs aren't narrow so even if you have to carry your bags up - it's not that bad. The room was fun with a bed suspended by wires from the ceiling - surprisingly comfy. Airplane seats were chairs - didn't use them but if you read the guestbook in the room I'm not sure you'd want to after having read some people's 'fantasies' about the seats. There was a shared bathroom that was never busy - never saw anyone else on our floor. Service was good, friendly desk staff, computer with free Internet in the lobby. Short walk from train station, Brandenburg gate, etc. We were there in the summer so the walk was fine but not sure I'd want to do it if the weather was bad like they said it gets there sometimes in the winter. Restaurants are a couple of blocks away - there's not much around the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: b_is_for_becca
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times now, always on the top floor with the shared bathroom. It’s always been a pleasant experience, staying twice in room 309 which has a wonderful comfy bed that gently rocks you to sleep. The location is great, 5 minutes from the Reichstag, 7 minutes from the Brandenburg Gate near to the restaurant lined street by the river Spree, bus stop from Tegal airport outside. The hotel is off a quieter main street and the rooms where I have stayed have been away from the front of the building and train line, I would heartily recommend checking if your desired room is on the side of the building next to the train line (expect noise) and if you are staying in the shared bathrooms (which are very clean and I have never had to share the bathroom) on the top floor be prepared to walk up a hefty flight of stairs. It’s a very relaxed hotel with bags of Berlin history and great location, it would be better if breakfast was included and the en suites are a little pricey for my purse but the shared bathroom rooms suit my pocket fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously whacky”
Reviews.Author: Kischka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the "hostel" type rooms as the hotel was full. This was a small private room with a single bed & access to a shared bathroom. It was not my first choice but perfectly adequate, & the in room artwork transports you out of that hostel vibe. The room was on one of the top floors, which was a minor marathon to reach by stairs (no lift access) after a full day walking Berlin. The shared bathroom was not great however. The bathroom itself is clean & accessible but the showers have a timer installed which automatically turns the water off after 30 seconds or so. Taking a shower was the most frustrating & laborious experience, my understanding was the rooms with private bathrooms did not have this problem. Great location, unlike other guests, i have no complaints re train noise, & slept very soundly. The service was great overall too, although the standard did differ between reception staff, some much friendlier than others though this may have something to do with the standard of english spoken between them. Overall good value & service, great location, quirky original hotel, but avoid the shared bathrooms if possible & try for a room close to the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were kind and accomidating. No check in until after 4”
Reviews.Author: maldoror23
Reviews.Content: My final night in Berlin I wanted to stay somewhere memorable and beautiful. Spent several months educating myself on the different neighborhoods and hotels and Arte Luise Kunsthotel was my hotel of choice for a brilliant comfortable last night. Mammel's Dream room with it's oversized bed was plush, comfortable and a one of a kind experience. The children's book that goes with the installation's story was the memorable experience that I was looking for. Staff were kind, accommodating and very knowledgeable with local information. Private bathroom seemed newly renovated and spotless. Rooms are not ready any earlier than 4 but they are happy to store luggage. Snack shop in lobby is reasonably priced and convienant. Free Internet was fast. Noticed several complaints online about noise from a train. In the Mammel's Dream room I did not experience this. Room was quiet. Now the negatives: No elevator on property 15min walk to the subway No bell staff to help lug the heavy luggage up flights of stairs TV in the room did not work The character and clenliness of the room mostly made up for any negatives and my next visit to Berlin I will definately consider staying with Arte Luise Kunsthotel again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL - VERY BAD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: ItalyMargot73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and very "Berlin mood", perfect to introcude yourself in the real Berlin. Well located, BUT SERVICE ARE TERRIBLE. Girls at reception doesn't speak a good english and it's hard to explain them what you need. Also we asked to book byclices for the day after and the receptionist told us it was not necessary they have enough bycicles for rent, actually the day after they didn't regret to tell us they have no more bycicles and they didn't help us at all to find some, what kind of service is this???

Reviews.Title: “Fun concept but dependant on room”
Reviews.Author: anarchy130
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit of a mixed bag. There's not much to it apart from your room and some of them verge on the claustrophobic or just a bit standard. I found the modern section a bit shabby and less interesting. The best and most characterful rooms are definitely the 'salons' the old ones (house dates back to 1820's) at the front, overlooking the street. There may not be a lift but the grand wooden staircase is great.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good art”
Reviews.Author: potterylady
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the oliver jordan suite, spacious ,clean and the art works made it really different. Drinks and snacks avaiable in foyer.The location is good near to stations, 5 mins from Brandenburg gate. Train noise not a problem. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, but trains are loud....”
Reviews.Author: sdcagoodlife
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, staff reasonably friendly. Located just a block away from a bus stop that will get you in from the airport for just 7 euro. I had read other reviews warning about the trains, so asked when I made the reservation if the room faced the rail lines. Was assured that it faced the street, so there would be no problem. Well, the windows faced the street, but the exterior wall was on the rail line and it was loud. Seems to be a commuter line, so only a few cars at a time and not all night, but did start up pretty early. Enjoyed dinner in the restaurant that's in the building (you need to exit the hotel and walk a door or two down) our first night there

Reviews.Title: “This is really a great place”
Reviews.Author: acc-tou
Reviews.Content: I had such a good time at this hotel in the summer of 2007 and feel that some of the negative reviews are not doing justice to the institution. My husband and I stayed for 3 nights, two at a newly renovated building and one at the old one. Unfortunately, the latter is not equipped with air conditioning and double glazing. Maybe that's why some gave out such harsh reviews. But the rooms in the new building are just amazing. Our room decorated as a bird's nest overlooked the parliament building, which was fantastic at night. And the room was right next to the train track but we could not hear a thing with the window closed. I remember my husband marveling at the German technology! The room becomes cold as soon as you turn the air conditioner on. The lobby is very arty, the backyard picturesque, and the location great. This hotel deserves much more than 3.5. Do not let negative reviews discourage you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nalaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June and liked it very much. It's so stylish. The experience was marvelous. It's location is central, it's easy to get anywhere you want. Still we had a problem which was that our first room Loop was near railroad station so it was very loud there. But we easily changed our room which has it windows facing inner garden so the problem was solved. Both rooms were great nevertheless. So I just recomend to specify if your windows will face railroad or no.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and quirky but don't expect to get any sleep!”
Reviews.Author: B_in_London
Reviews.Content: My brother and I decided to use this as our base to explore Berlin, from the website it looked very cool and we stayed in a funky room all spray-painted gold with bananas all over the walls and hot-pink velvet bedding and curtains. But the fun stopped there. When we arrived we found packets of earplugs on the bedside table, NOT a good start. Then when we opened the curtains we found the railway RIGHT BY THE WINDOW. Bit scary. Very loud. My advice would be to drink as much of the local beer as possible before retiring for the night, otherwise you won't sleep. Also, when we were checking out the woman behind the counter was EXTREMELY rude and obnoxious and kept pulling faces at my brother. He's not used to crazy Europeans so was a bit offended :) But otherwise, easy to get to, central and surrounded by great bars, restaurants and places to see.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pdxbirdy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2007. Our room was in the "budget" section of the building over looking the gorgeous, quiet courtyard. The room had gorgeous high ceilings, the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in, and was completely spotless. Our washroom was down the hall, but seemed to only be used by us. It was very comfortable and sparkling clean. We found the hotel staff to be very pleasant and helpful. The location is very convenient to the train station and major sights. This is a very unique urban hotel--almost worthy by itself of a trip to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but you better love trains”
Reviews.Author: m_h72
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just stayed at the Arte Luise Kunsthotel in Berlin. It sells itself as one of Berlin's cool, artist-designed hotels, and we were looking forward to staying in a unique room with an individual design, near to the thriving centre of Berlin. The hotel certainly has a fantastic location, 5 minutes taxi ride from the Hauptbahnhof, and 5 minutes walk from the Reichstag and Brandenburg Gate. However, the room was a disappointment - large, but with somewhat damaged art on the walls, and the noise from passing trains was pretty overwhelming at first (the hotel is virtually on the line between the Hauptbahnhof and Friedrichstrasse). You know it must be noisy when the hotel supplies earplugs in the room... In its defence, you do get used to sleeping with the earplugs, the surrounding neighbourhood has some great cafes, and it's only about 90 euros a night (which is cheap for a hotel in the Mitte district). I also suspect if we had paid for a more expensive room, we would have been more sheltered from the street/train noise. Takeaway lesson: if you want to appreciate the art and the location, trade up for a swankier room and ask about noise when booking.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nashville1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Art Luise for six nights at the end of June. There are really two separate hotels--the new wing in which we stayed and the older section. They are completely different places. The rooms in the new wing are very modern with excellent sound proofing and a very good central a/c system. There is a elevator. Even though the rooms are next to the train tracks, we had no problem with the noise. The hotel spent quite a bit of money on the sound proofing and it works. The odd thing is that automatic blinds were installed outside the windows. They do not do a very good job of keeping out the light--that was a far bigger problem than the noise. Also the rooms do not have clocks. Bring your travel alarm or have a cell phone that works in Germany because we did not get our wake up call to either room for our early flight home. The location is great--a 5 or 10 minute walk to Friedrichstrasse station with lots of good local restaurants along the way. We would definitely stay (in the new wing) again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelpam
Reviews.Content: Our group occupied 3 rooms at this hotel in June, 2007 and had a wonderful experience. We stayed in the new section right on top of the rail line and had no disturbance at all from the train that ran there well into the night. Due to the double - double paned windows, there was virtually very little sound. This is a great area of town to be located in, staff was friendly and rooms very clean. We had an excellent breakfast daily located next door in the restaurant. I highly recommend staying in the new section of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: justwundering
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, friendly hotel but it is not for everyone. There is no elevator in the 'old' section of the hotel so if you are on the top floor--expect to carry your luggage up three flights of stairs (there isn't a door man or bell hop to assist you). I am not quite sure if they have an elevator in the new section of the hotel so check before you register if this is an issue for you. As one individual mentioned, the train tracks are located near the hotel so if you are a light sleeper - bring earplugs. Also, there were some rooms that were single rooms with one bed (you would need to share a bathroom). Our room had a small clean bathroom adjacent to our room. On the plus side, the staff was very friendly and helpful-probably one of the best during our two week stay in Germany. The location is great - easy walking distance to some of the main attractions, obviously near the train station, and a short walk to the bus terminal. The breakfast was served in a restaurant next door which served cereal, fruit, cheese, meats, and great German bread. The hotel is suited for older children but may be difficult for someone with small children. I believe it is a hotel suited for couples on vacation and business travelers. The art throughout the hotel would be classified as 'very modern'. We had a 'minimalist' room which was a fairly accurate description. My husband would stay here again but it would not be my first choice. It's a nice hotel but definetly not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Miolaran
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kunstlerheim Luise for our first 2 nights in Berlin--what a great way to start! Our 2 rooms had very different art installations in them (our daughters chose the one outfitted like a giant seagull's nest, complete with hovering beak and huge eggs). We also asked for rooms with air-conditioning, for which we were very grateful during the recent heat wave. Our rooms were on the S-bahn side 2 floors up; other reviews have noted that this side can be noisy from the trains, but we could barely hear them. Breakfast in the adjoining restaurant is wonderful (and enjoys the occasional shake from the trains going by at this level). The hotel is near the Friedrichstrasse bahnhof and convenient for travel, shopping and restaurants. Staff was very pleasant, beds were beautiful and comfortable, and bathrooms were pristine. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Finbar_x
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights in Jul 2006. Listen to me carefully: this place is LOUD. Like, unbelievably loud. It is right beside a train station. In the first room we saw, it was so loud we couldn't hear each other. No human being can sleep with such a din. However - when we asked to move to a quieter room, the staff was VERY helpful and found us a room in a quiet(er) corner. So we had a happy ending. The best thing about this place - you can get breakfast next door for 8 euros, and it is completely worth it - it was probably the best breakfast we had in all of Germany. One more thing - no elevator, so I hope you like climbing stairs.

Reviews.Title: “This could be the answer for your trip to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: odyssea
Reviews.Content: Have just spent four days in one of the small single rooms on the top floor with en suite facilities which are offered to budget travellers or `visiting artists'. On the plus side, the rooms were immaculately clean with an exceptionally comfortable bed. Mine was a `themed' room too which surprised me as I thought that these artistic flourishes only extended to the pricier accommodation. The reception staff were pleasant and helpful with the exception of one member of staff who struggled with English and did not know the price of breakfast. (Sounds petty? Thank goodness I wasn't a hotel inspector) The hotel itself enjoys a first-rate location just minutes away from Unter den Linden, the Reichstag and the Brandenburg Gate. And it's beautiful to look at. On the minus side... There is no way round this. The hotel is next to a high speed railway line. Some of the rooms are just metres away. Mine wasn't - but the noise was thunderous at times - as if the train was heading straight for the room! Anyone who has stayed here will know I am not exaggerating! This is scarcely the hotel's fault but I would advise anyone who's sensitive to noise to steer well clear. The budget quarter where I stayed is VERY spartan - those who value home comforts can forget it. It's hostel standard and if that's what you want, great. Otherwise, look elsewhere! There are no facilities like a bar in the hotel itself -just a drinks machine. In fairness there is a restaurant next door - Weinguy- which seems to have struck a deal with the hotel and serves breakfast to guests. It's NOT included in the price of the room and will cost you eight euros. Having said that it was worth the money and the surroundings were lovely. I got some very good feedback about their business lunch and evening meals. Because I wasn't staying in the customised rooms designed by artists, I don't know if I am that great a spokesperson for this hotel. I would however be interested to hear what you tripadvisor members have to say about this pricier part of the tariff

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: xxxooo
Reviews.Content: This past December we stayed twice at the Hotel Kunstler Luise in Berlin, having stayed there once before four years ago. They offer a variety of accomodations, from singles to suites, and every room is decorated differently by local artists. We spent five days there, through New Years Eve, before going to Dresden, and stayed there again on our return. All of the front desk staff speaks english, and are extremely cordial. They allowed me to use the internet system located at the front desk for checking email, flight information, etc. As long as you're not greedy with time, there's no charge. The location provides easy access to the subway system, as well as a good selection of nearby restaurants. Each room has a unique artistic flavor, and the beds are quite comfortable. In fact, you can see images of the rooms on their website and request specific artists. A good buffet breakfast, consisting of breads, eggs, bacon, fruit, yogurt, etc., can be had in the restaurant next door (8 euros). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone as it's both charming and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Very unusual”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel on two different stays in 2003, but it is not for everyone. Each room has been designed and decorated by a different local artist. Very unique. Clean. Spacious lobby. The location is excellent, right near the Reichstag and Unter den Linden. We would definitely stay here again. A word of warning: the hotel is located right next to the train tracks. I found the sounds of trains rather comforting, but people who are light sleepers are going to have a real problem. (The rooms do provide ear plugs.) Breakfast at the next-door Weinguy was excellent, simple but varied enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son picked this hotel out of the Lonely Planet book on Berlin. It had arrived that morning from Amazon. We were pleased to find that we were able to book two rooms on the 3rd floor without difficulty, although to get the configuration we required we could not get either with ensuite WC or shower. This didn't matter nearly as much as we anticipated as we seemed to be the only guests on the floor, certainly the only ones using the large shared bathroom. The place was warm, very well fitted out, almost completely free of smoke (possibly these were explicitly non-smoking rooms) and very interesting. Apart from a couple of bulbs that had blown the room was free of all defects. The stairs are a bit of a climb but this was probably a good thing considering the number of gut-busting meals we ate in Berlin over the tree days. Breakfast at WeinGuy next door was excellent with extremely friendly and efficient service. The croissants were the best I've tasted anywhere in Europe and certainly better than anything available in the UK. We paid about eur 420 for three nights for two rooms.
